Package: gov.noaa.messageapi.interfaces

[Java] Interface IResponse

  • Responses are the processing center and result aggregation repository for requests. When a request is submitted, it immediately returns a response, which executes any processing steps (validation, factoring, transformation, etc.) in sequence, eventually yielding a set of returned data packets from endpoint connections, where it combines them and sets a response list of records, list of rejections, and changes the isComplete Boolean to true.

    Authors:
    Ryan Berkheimer

    • Properties Summary

        Properties 
        Type Name and description
        java.util.List<IRecord>  records
        java.util.List<IRejection>  rejections

    • Methods Summary

        Methods 
        Type Params Return Type Name and description
        java.util.List<IRecord> getRecords()
        Returns the list of records added to the response as a result of any processing done within the associated request.
        java.util.List<IRejection> getRejections()
        Returns the list of rejections as applied to the request that is contained by the response.
        IRequest getRequest()
        Returns the associated request that the response is responsible for processing.
        java.lang.Boolean isComplete()
        Returns true or false, depending on if all processing within the response is complete.
        void setComplete(java.lang.Boolean isComplete)
        Sets the completion status of the response.
        void setRecords(java.util.List<IRecord> records)
        Sets the records in the response to the passed record list.
        void setRejections(java.util.List<IRejection> rejections)
        Sets the rejections in the response to the passed rejection list.

    • Property Detail

      • java.util.List<IRecord> records

      • java.util.List<IRejection> rejections

    • Method Detail

      • public java.util.List<IRecord> getRecords()

        Returns the list of records added to the response as a result of any processing done within the associated request.

      • public java.util.List<IRejection> getRejections()

        Returns the list of rejections as applied to the request that is contained by the response.

      • public IRequest getRequest()

        Returns the associated request that the response is responsible for processing. The request is typically deep-copied when submitted, so it will contain the exact conditions it did at the time of calling submit.

      • public java.lang.Boolean isComplete()

        Returns true or false, depending on if all processing within the response is complete.

      • public void setComplete(java.lang.Boolean isComplete)

        Sets the completion status of the response. This value should be set to true when all request processing is complete, so the caller knows that there are no more records or rejections coming through for the current submission.

      • public void setRecords(java.util.List<IRecord> records)

        Sets the records in the response to the passed record list. This replaces any existing records in the response.

      • public void setRejections(java.util.List<IRejection> rejections)

        Sets the rejections in the response to the passed rejection list. This replaces any existing rejections in the response.
